messageBody:
>So said bernd on 2003-08-01 --------------------
>
>Hi,
>
>> am. At what
>> point does a unit test of an aggregating object, or subclass,
>> become an
>> integration test? My head hurts.
>
>My home-grown definition is: When the object(s) under test depend
>on slow, complex external resources. e.g. databases, filesystems,
>user interfaces(?), remote objects, ...

An "integration test" can be loosely defined as a test whose assertions depend on the expected behavior of a collaborator of the object under test.

A "unit test" can then be defined as a test that is not an integration test.
